title: OPPtools
text: package fork CIDAtools, allows setup standardized .Rproj directory following preset subdirectories: 01_Raw_data 02_Analysis 03_Working_files 04_Processed 05_Admin addition, README.md file generated newly created directories describe files contained within. install OPPtools local machine:

title: OPPtools
text: OPPtools installed, new OPP project can created using Rstudio GUI (File>New Project>New Directory>New OPP Project). , create new project folder structure R console, navigate main project directory, run: Feel free set project name, PI, analyst via ProjectName, PI, analyst arguments respectively, see ?CreateProject details. specified, stored text hidden subdirectory called .ProjData, can called subsequent R code anywhere project using ProjectName(), ProjectPI(), ProjectAnalyst().

code: snippet header     ###########################################     # Project: `r OPPtools::ProjectName()`     # Author: `r OPPtools::ProjectAnalyst()`     # Date: `r paste(format(Sys.Date(), '%m/%d/%Y'))`     # #########################################

title: OPP workflow
text: OPPtools package can downloaded installed Github previously downloaded devtools package. second package need workflow track2KBA, available download CRAN.

title: OPP workflow
text: workflow package designed work smoothly data stored Movebank. order download data, need provide Movebank credentials. OPPtools optional convenience function, opp_movebank_key, allows securely store encrypted copy Movebank credentials. set credentials way, prompted enter Movebank credentials future function calls. can download data directly Movebank. stored credentials using opp_movebank_key, data downloaded directly. Otherwise, prompted enter Movebank username password console. examples, data thick-billed murres Coats Island also already bundled package.
code: opp_movebank_key(username = "my_movebank_username") # You will then be prompted to enter your password murres <- opp_download_data(248994009) data(murres) # same output as `opp_download_data(248994009)`  knitr::kable(head(murres))

title: OPP workflow
text: opp_map function allows quickly plot raw Movebank tracks visualize . orange dot represents Movebank project site, case seabirds colony location.  Another useful thing examine prior continuing workflow simple plot time traveled vs. distance colony bird. Looking allow make informed decisions minimum maximum distances traveled individual foraging trips addition time elapsed foraging trips.

title: OPP workflow
text: track exploration, can extract reasonable trip parameters next stage workflow: opp_get_trips function. seems trips characterized minimum distance least 2 km away colony. Additionally, distance 15 km seems reasonable capture trips bird went offshore logger died (.e., incomplete trips). 15 km value used opp_get_trips mark incomplete trips. Finally, based plots, looks like want filter tracks spend less 2 hours away colony. short, ’re saying tracks achieve distance >2 km away colony least 2 hours can qualify ‘trip’. also need trim data using opp2KBA function.
code: innerBuff = 2 # (km) minimum distance from the colony to be in a trip returnBuff = 15 # (km) outer buffer to capture incomplete return trips duration = 2 # (hrs) minimum trip duration  murres <- opp2KBA(murres)

title: OPP workflow
text: opp_get_trips function return SpatialPointsDataFrame containing GPS track locations bird, grouped trip ID. also label GPS points deemed part trip. showPlots = TRUE (default), plots visualizing trips output.
code: trips <- opp_get_trips(murres,                         innerBuff = innerBuff,                         returnBuff = returnBuff,                        duration = duration)

title: OPP workflow
text: One primary end-data products workflow kernel density estimate seabird space use. However, key statistical assumption kernel densities even sampling regime. case GPS points, mean even gap time data point. current data satisfy assumption. account , must first interpolate data. OPPTools library uses crawl interpolation method . See ?ctcrw_interpolation information. output plots ctcrw_interpolation similar ones , except addition green circles. green circles indicate interpolated tracks. function interpolated tracks identified “Complete” opp_get_trips . can adjusted type argument function.
code: interp <- ctcrw_interpolation(trips,                               site = murres$site,                               type = "Complete",                               timestep = "2 min")

title: OPP workflow
text: OPPtools comes function quickly explore trip details. accepts output either opp_get_trips ctcrw_interpolation. run sum_trips interpolated output, table provide raw interpolated number GPS locations.
code: # opp_get_trips output knitr::kable(sum_trips(trips)) # ctcrw_interpolation output knitr::kable(sum_trips(interp))

title: OPP workflow
text: two mapping methods exploring key marine sites seabirds using OPPtools: first traditional kernel density estimate, second Brownian Bridge Movement Model (BBMM) kernel density estimate. first output summarized presented track2KBA mapping approach, second simple BBMM 50% 95% UD contour.

title: OPP workflow
text: traditional KDE workflow adapted track2KBA workflow, can found greater detail . track2KBA workflow simplified condensed within OPPtools package. Kernel smoothers calculated within function generates kernel . default, href method calculating kernel smoothers used. See ?opp_kernel details.
code: kde <- opp_kernel(interp,                   res = 1 # grid resolution in sq km                   )

title: OPP workflow
OPP workflow
text: either kernels, can use ud_stack function interested taking look population-level raster. ud_stack accepts weights argument want weigh certain tracks important others stack. example, weight bbmm kernels number locations track. want longer tracks (go farther colony) importance population level kernel. common workflow rasterized UDs typically involves extracting 50% 99% volume contours. ud_vol function, can specify contours want extract reclassify raster show two contour values:
code: # Using a combination of aggregate and sum_trips,  # let's pull out the number of locations per animal n_locs <- aggregate(interp_n_locs ~ ID, data = sum_trips(interp), sum)[[2]]  # Stack our bbmm kernels, weighted by n_locs pop_bbmm <- ud_stack(bb_kde, n_locs)  # Might be nice to compare to non-weighted  # Now we can visualize mapview::mapview(pop_bbmm) # By default, the two volume levels are 50% and 99%, but these can be changed if desired. pop_vols <- ud_vol(pop_bbmm)  raster::plot(pop_vols)

what:
Interpolate GPS locations at a set time interval using a continuous time correlated
random walk (ctcrw) model — ctcrw_interpolation
title:
Interpolate GPS locations at a set time interval using a continuous time correlated
random walk (ctcrw) model — ctcrw_interpolation
text: function wrapper momentuHMM::crawlWrap(), uses crawl package fit ctcrw model GPS tracks user-defined time interval. function currently designed handle GPS data central place foraging birds. takes tracking data, trips identified classified using OPPTools::opp_get_trips(). function returns list four objects: (1) original tracking data (SPDF), (2) colony location (SPDF), (3) interpolated locations (SPDF), (4) list CRAWL fits trip. spatial objects custom Lambert equal area projection centered colony.

title:
Interpolate GPS locations at a set time interval using a continuous time correlated
random walk (ctcrw) model — ctcrw_interpolation
code: ctcrw_interpolation(   data,   site,   type,   timestep,   interpolateGaps = TRUE,   showPlots = TRUE,   plotsPerPage = 4,   theta = c(8, 2),   quiet = TRUE )

title:
Interpolate GPS locations at a set time interval using a continuous time correlated
random walk (ctcrw) model — ctcrw_interpolation
text: data Trip data ouptut OPPTools::opp_get_trips(). site Vector containing coordinates study site, format site information returned OPPtools::opp2KBA track2KBA::move2KBA. type List indicating types trips include interpolation. Possible values : 'Complete', 'Incomplete', 'Gappy', 'Non-trip'. Default 'Complete'. timestep string indicating time step track interpolation, eg. '10 min', '1 hour', '1 day' showPlots TRUE/FALSE plots interpolated tracks original data produced plotsPerPage Numeric indicating number individuals include single plot. Defaults 4. theta starting values ctcrw parameter optimization, see ?crawl::crwMLE details

Defaults 20. duration Minimum trip duration (hrs) gapLimit Maximum time points considered large contiguous tracking event. what: Calculate traditional kernel density estimates — opp_kernel

text: function wrapper track2KBA::estSpaceUse (wrapper adehabitatHR::kernelUD) calculate traditional kernel density estimates given set trips. function accepts outputs either opp_get_trips ctcrw_interpolation. provided output ctcrw_interpolation, function calculate kernels using interpolated tracks default. behavior can changed setting interpolated = FALSE. default kernel smoother calculated using href method. default UD level 50%.

title: Calculate traditional kernel density estimates — opp_kernel
text: data Tracks calculate kernels . Accepts output either opp_get_trips ctcrw_interpolation. interpolated Logical (T/F). provided output ctcrw_interpolation, interpolated tracks used kernel calculation? Default TRUE. parameter ignored function provided data opp_get_tracks. extendGrid Numeric. Distance (km) expand grid beyond bounding box tracking data. Default 10km. smoother Smoother value used kernel calculations, either numeric value 'href' 'step'. default uses calculated href value tracks. Using 'step' use median step length across tracks. res Grid resolution sq km use kernel calculations.

title: Map and compare different UD smoothers for individual tracks — opp_map_indUD
text: uds Named list estUDm estUD objects plot. returned opp_kernel. ud_levels List numeric values 1-99, indicting utilization distribution levels plot. tracks SpatialPointsDataFrame location data used opp_kernel. center Data frame containing columns 'Longitude' 'Latitude' decimal degrees, plotting colony nest locations. zoom NULL numeric value 1:16, indicating zoom level map. left NULL (default) map extent defined bounding box tracks. numeric value provided, bounding box cenetered mean location tracks zoom level provided. coast_scale Mapping resolution coastline basemap. Must one : 10 - high resolution, 50 - medium resolution, 110 - low resolution. viridis_option character string indicating colormap option use. Four options available: "magma" (""), "inferno" ("B"), "plasma" ("C"), "viridis" ("D", default option) "cividis" ("E").

title: Map and compare different UD smoothers for individual tracks — opp_map_indUD
text: named list ggplot objects, one slot individual uds. #'@examples my_data <- opp_download_data(study = c(1247096889), login = NULL, start_month = NULL, end_month = NULL,season = NULL) my_track2kba <- opp2KBA(data = my_data) my_trips <- opp_get_trips(data = my_track2kba, innerBuff  = 1, returnBuff = 10, duration  = 1, gapLimit = 100, gapTime = 1, gapDist = 12, showPlots = F) my_interp <- ctcrw_interpolation(data = my_trips, site = my_track2kba$site, type = c('Complete','Incomplete','Gappy'), timestep = '10 min', interpolateGaps = F, showPlots = T, theta = c(8,2), quiet = F ) (hh <- opp_href(my_interp$interp)) my_ud_href1 <- opp_kernel(data = my_interp, interpolated = TRUE, smoother = hh/1, extendGrid = 30, res = 1) my_ud_href2 <- opp_kernel(data = my_interp, interpolated = TRUE, smoother = hh/2, extendGrid = 30, res = 1) my_plots_step <- opp_map_indUD( uds = list(Href1 = my_ud_href1,Href2 = my_ud_href2), tracks = my_interp$interp, center = my_track2kba$site, ud_levels = c(50,75,90), coast_scale = 50, viridis_option = '' ) my_plots_step[1] my_plots_step[2]
